aiContext.projectSummary: Snow-Flow is a conversational ServiceNow development platform that uses MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers to enable natural language ServiceNow development. Instead of navigating ServiceNow's web interface, developers talk to AI assistants that orchestrate multi-agent workflows.
keyFiles: CLAUDE.md - Snow-Flow best practices and configuration guide
src/mcp/ - All MCP servers for ServiceNow integration
commonTasks: Query ServiceNow tables: Use snow_query_table MCP tool
Create ServiceNow widgets: Use snow_create_widget or snow_deploy
Pull artifacts for editing: Use snow_pull_artifact
importantRules: Always use ES5 JavaScript syntax in ServiceNow (no const/let/arrow functions)
For widget debugging, use snow_pull_artifact instead of snow_query_table
Use conversational development - describe what you want instead of coding
Leverage multi-agent coordination for complex ServiceNow tasks

suggestions.widgetDevelopment: For widget issues, always use 'snow_pull_artifact' to edit locally rather than querying fields separately. This avoids token limits and enables native editing tools.
suggestions.serviceNowSyntax: Remember: ServiceNow uses Rhino JavaScript engine (ES5 only). No modern syntax like const/let, arrow functions, template literals.
suggestions.conversationalApproach: Instead of writing code manually, describe what you want: 'Create an incident dashboard with real-time charts' rather than coding each component.

keyCommands: npm run build - Build all MCP servers
npx snow-flow auth login - Authenticate with ServiceNow
